con:interface.name: Involved Party Management APIs
con:interface.con:description: A group of services that relate to the creation and management of an involved party's details

con:parameter.con:name: involvedPartyId
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the unique Identifier used to identify an InvolvedParty

con:method.name: Get
con:method.con:description: This service take a CIS ID of an Individual and returns related details storedGets an Involved Party Details

con:parameter.con:name: X-Additional-Info
con:parameter.con:description: This object holds information in addition to the other header fields below. The strings should be populated in a name/value pair format as follows; ["ProcessID 123456789", "ParentProcessID 66213"]. Name value pair is separated by a blank space character. Name must not contain a space but the value may contain.The values within the identifier should meet the criteria belowstring max length of 121 and pattern of^[a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+[ ][ a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+$This pattern means 2 strings of sepparated by 1 delimiting space character.The first string is for the name and the second for the value.The second string accepts spaces, but the first don't.

con:parameter.con:name: X-Channel
con:parameter.con:description: Please refer TMS domain 'BusinessTransactionCommunicationChannelCode' for the list of possible values. Sample Values include POST OFFICE INTERNET MOBILE

con:parameter.con:name: X-Channel-Alternate-Id
con:parameter.con:description: This string holds the channel alternate identifiers. It contains sub-strings that should be populated in a name/value pair format as follows. 'name value' for example ["MACHINEID 123.123.123.123", "CUSTOMERID 1234567891"]. The following values are allowed for name CASHIERID CUSTOMERID EMPLOYEEID MACHINEID TERMINALID USERID FUNCTIONALUNITID The values within the identifier should meet the criteria belowstring max length of 121 and pattern of^[a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+[ ][ a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+$This pattern means 2 strings of sepparated by 1 delimiting space character. The first string is for the type and the second for the identifier. The second string accepts spaces, but the first don't.

con:parameter.con:name: X-Virtual-Environment
con:parameter.con:description: Where a project shares environments with other projects, this field is used to create a"virtual environment". Consumers can pass this such that the service gateway routes toa project specific version. The main purpose of this field is to aid testing andproduction proving. Once the service is live and proven, it typically no longer servesa purpose.Example value "EM2DAY2".

con:parameter.con:name: X-Schema-Version
con:parameter.con:description: This is a way for the consumer to communicate what version of the specification it has. For example a consumer may still operate using v1.0 while the service is at v1.1 (at which point "v1.1" will be added to the enumeration above). This field is used for two purposes- it will allow the service to ensure the consumer receives a compatible response- we can deploy a new minor version alongside an existing minor version, and routethe service to either based on this field (and other info). Based on testing /proving the service will ultimately switch to the final version.

con:parameter.con:name: X-Journey-Id
con:parameter.con:description: A unique identifier populated by the consumer. It follows the UUID pattern, for example 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000

con:parameter.con:name: X-Source-System-Id
con:parameter.con:description: Please refer TMS domain 'BusinessSystemID' for the list of possible values. SampleValues includeDISCOVERYBASE24CIS

con:parameter.con:name: X-Create-Date-Time
con:parameter.con:description: Time stamp associated with creation of the request message, utilisting the UTC ISO 8601 Date Time format. For example 2017-01-01T00:00:00 or 2017-01-01T00:00:00.001Z

con:parameter.con:name: X-IP-Address
con:parameter.con:description: The IPv4/IPv6 address of the caller.

The following values are allowed for name CASHIERID CUSTOMERID EMPLOYEEID MACHINEID TERMINALID USERID FUNCTIONALUNITID The values within the identifier should meet the criteria belowstring max length of 121 and pattern of^[a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+[ ][ a-zA-Z0-9,_\'\.\-]+$This pattern means 2 strings of sepparated by 1 delimiting space character. The first string is for the type and the second for the identifier. The second string accepts spaces, but the first don't.

con:parameter.con:name: X-Virtual-Environment
con:parameter.con:description: Where a project shares environments with other projects, this field is used to create a"virtual environment". Consumers can pass this such that the service gateway routes toa project specific version. The main purpose of this field is to aid testing andproduction proving. Once the service is live and proven, it typically no longer servesa purpose.Example value "EM2DAY2".

con:parameter.con:name: X-Schema-Version
con:parameter.con:description: This is a way for the consumer to communicate what version of the specification it has. For example a consumer may still operate using v1.0 while the service is at v1.1 (at which point "v1.1" will be added to the enumeration above). This field is used for two purposes- it will allow the service to ensure the consumer receives a compatible response- we can deploy a new minor version alongside an existing minor version, and routethe service to either based on this field (and other info). Based on testing /proving the service will ultimately switch to the final version.

con:parameter.con:name: X-Journey-Id
con:parameter.con:description: A unique identifier populated by the consumer. It follows the UUID pattern, for example 123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000

con:parameter.con:name: X-Source-System-Id
con:parameter.con:description: Please refer TMS domain 'BusinessSystemID' for the list of possible values. SampleValues includeDISCOVERYBASE24CIS

con:parameter.con:name: X-Create-Date-Time
con:parameter.con:description: Time stamp associated with creation of the request message, utilisting the UTC ISO 8601 Date Time format. For example 2017-01-01T00:00:00 or 2017-01-01T00:00:00.001Z

con:parameter.con:name: X-IP-Address
con:parameter.con:description: The IPv4/IPv6 address of the caller.
